div1.p: Lazear offers his opinions on Cuba.

div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, April 26, 1900
div1.opener:
DR. JESSE W. LAZEAR,
835 PARK AVE.
OFFICE HOURS,
4.30-6 P.M.
BALTIMORE.
Columbia Barracks
BALTIMORE. Apr. 26. 1900
My dear Mother,-
div1.p:
I was glad to get your letter
of Apr. 21. I am glad you liked the
Mantilla. I was afraid it might be too
old for you but everyone wears them here,
Kodak pictures are always interesting
I hope Mabel had the others developed
before she went to Boston.

I wrote to Mabel this evening and directed
the letter to Boston if she has not
yet gave please tell I did so.

I hope she got along all right with
the moving. It was quite a job.

It gets partly warm here now in the
daytime but it does not bother me
any. The climate here is really very
good. There is a sea breeze all the time.
If the island was settled with sensible
industrious people I think it would be
the best place in the tropics to live in.
I was glad to hear about Houston
He is a very interesting little chap. and I
am sorry he and Mabel cannot be with
me but its all in the day's work
